introduction.p1: Gluco Check brings Nightscout to your Google Assistant. Ask it things like
introduction.features1: my blood sugar / my BG / my glucose
introduction.features2: my insulin on board / IOB / insulin
introduction.features3: my carbs on board / COB / carbs
introduction.features5: How old is my cannula / When did I insert my cannula?

welcome.title: Welcome to Gluco Check
welcome.content: Content about the product, more practical scenarios featuring ways to use it in your life in novel ways.

settings.title: Edit Settings
settings.content: Gluco Check works by talking to your Nightscout site. Enter details about your site below. Additional metrics (beyond current blood glucose) require a valid token.

nightscoutToken.default: Not sure how to get a token? Read on!
nightscoutToken.empty: A token is required to read additional metrics
nightscoutToken.invalid: Your Nightscout site is not accepting this token

nightscoutUrl.notNightscout: This URL does not point to a Nightscout site
nightscoutUrl.needsUpgrade: Your Nightscout site requires an update to work with Gluco Check, please update to at least {{version}}

defaultMetrics.default: Assistant will read these items to you by default
defaultMetrics.required: You must select at least one metric
defaultMetrics.notAvailable: * We did not find a recent value for these metrics, but you can still select them

glucoseUnits.mismatch: Chosen unit differs from your Nightscout site's units

submitStatus.error: Something has gone horribly wrong saving your settings

tokenDialog.title: Generating a Nightscout token
tokenDialog.preamble: For basic features like checking your numbers, your Nightscout url is enough. For more advanced features, you're going to need a token with full api read permissions. If you don't know what that means, don't sweat it! We'll go through it one step at a time.

step1.label: Check Nightscout Version
step1.description: First, make sure your site is on at least version 14 of Nightscout. You can check the version here by clicking on the hamburger menu button and looking here:

step2.label: Update Nightscout
step2.description: If you do need an upgrade, you can read more about how to do that <2>here</2>. If not, let's make that token!

step3.label: Create Role and Subject
step3.description: Click on the hamburger menu, then "Admin Tools".

step4.description: Click on "Add new Role", populate the Role with the values pictured below, and click save.

step5.description: Click on "Add new Subject", populate the Subject with the values pictured below, and click save.

step6.description: Copy the value in the "Access Token" column, paste it into the Nightscout Token field in <2>Gluco-Check Settings</2>, and click save.

medicalDisclaimer.title: Healthcare information disclaimer
medicalDisclaimer.p1: The information provided by Nightscout Status is not a substitute for advice from a medical professional. If you have questions about treatment or need advice, remember to always ask your doctor!

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.intro: This document describes the information being collected by Nightscout Status, https://nielsmaerten.github.io/nightscout-assistant (the "Service" or the "Software") and how this information is used.

p1.title: What information is collected?
p1.body: The Service needs 2 things in order to work: the email address of your Google Account (so it can know it's you when you make a request), and the URL of your Nightscout instance (so it can look up your glucose and read it to you).

p2.title: How is this information used?
p2.body: When you invoke the Service through Google Assistant (i.e.: by saying: 'Hey Google, talk to Nightscout Status), the Service looks at your email address, and checks if there's a Nightscout site associated with it. If so, your current glucose level is read from your Nightscout site.

p3.title: Sharing of information
p3.body: Your email address or Nightscout URL will **never** be shared with a third party. I just need it so I know which Nightscout site to check when you invoke the Action. Data from your Nightscout website is not saved, not even to log files.

p4.title: Deleting your data
p4.body: You can choose to revoke access at any time: Simply via log in, remove your Nightscout URL, and click Save. You can also remove Nightscout Status from your Google Account.

p5.title: Analytics Cookie
p5.body: After you sign in to this site, some anonymous statistics about your visit are collected using a cookie (Google Analytics). The cookie is not enabled until after you've accepted this Privacy Policy. I'm using Analytics to better understand how people are using this site, how they found it, and which demographic they're in. This only applies to <2>https://nielsmaerten.github.io/nightscout-assistant</2>, not to usage of the Assistant Action itself. If you'd like to opt-out of the Google Analytics cookie, you can do so by visiting <4>https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout/</4>
